personal.name: Rupam Patil
personal.title: AI Engineer Who Ships | RAG Pipelines ‚Üí Production Deployments
bio: AI Engineer with proven expertise in Python, LLMs, and NLP-driven applications
Specialized in designing RAG pipelines, prompt engineering, and cloud deployments
Building systems that actually ship - from prototype to reliable, scalable production solutions
Started detecting gravitational waves with CNNs at IUCAA, now deploying production AI systems
Recent wins: Production RAG systems (LangChain + Azure OpenAI), 50% efficiency boost, led 70-member AI community

experience.title: Associate Data Scientist
experience.description: Architected and deployed production-ready RAG chatbots using Python (FastAPI), LangChain, and Azure services with PostgreSQL backend, improving policy retrieval efficiency by 50%. Developed and fine-tuned LLM-powered pipelines with prompt engineering and vector search, reducing transaction analysis time by 40%. Implemented foundation models and large language models (Azure OpenAI, TensorFlow) with end-to-end deployment.

experience.title: Intern - IT Operations Analyst
experience.description: Designed and implemented AI POCs for IT operations automation using Python, scikit-learn, and cloud services, improving monitoring efficiency by 30%. Engineered NLP-based log analysis pipelines for anomaly detection and pattern recognition, reducing manual monitoring overhead by 20%.

experience.title: Research Intern - LIGO Project
experience.company: IUCAA (Inter-University Centre for Astronomy and Astrophysics)
experience.description: Applied CNN/LSTM architectures to classify Gravitational Wave signals, achieving improved detection accuracy in noisy datasets. Leveraged PyCBC & Q-transform techniques for time series generation and noise augmentation, enhancing ML-based signal recognition performance.

experience.title: President
experience.description: Led a team of 70 members driving impactful initiatives and events. Organized conferences, workshops, and hackathons promoting innovation in AI/ML. Collaborated with executive team to establish strategic goals, oversee operations, and promote sponsor engagement. Enhanced leadership, communication, and project management abilities through community building.

projects.name: Career Assistant Agent
projects.description: Engineered a GenAI Career Assistant using LangChain, LangGraph, and Gemini LLMs, streamlining agent workflows and RAG pipelines to cut query resolution time by 40%. Developed LLM-driven modules for tutorials, resumes, and mock interviews, boosting user engagement by 3√ó through prompt engineering and vector search. Integrated PostgreSQL and vector databases (Milvus) to enable context-aware AI responses, improving retrieval accuracy by 25% in production tests.

projects.name: Privacy Management in Real-time Videos
projects.description: Enhanced real-time video privacy by developing DL-driven object detection pipelines using YOLOv8 and OpenCV, achieving 90% accuracy in masking sensitive regions. Designed a Python-based GUI integrated with ML models, reducing configuration and monitoring time by 40%. Optimized video processing speed by leveraging GPU acceleration, improving efficiency by 2x, ensuring scalability for diverse deployment environments.

projects.name: Production RAG Chatbots
projects.description: Deployed production RAG chatbots using Azure OpenAI and LangChain with FastAPI backends integrating AI models with enterprise systems. Optimized vector databases (FAISS, Milvus) for semantic search. Built LLM pipelines with prompt engineering achieving 50% improvement in policy retrieval efficiency.

projects.name: ML-based Anomaly Detection
projects.description: Created ML-based anomaly detection system for financial transactions with Power BI dashboards for high-volume financial data visualization. Engineered scalable pipelines for real-time transaction monitoring and pattern recognition.

projects.name: NLP Log Analysis Pipeline
projects.description: Engineered NLP-based log analysis pipelines for anomaly detection and pattern recognition at CrowdStrike, reducing manual monitoring overhead by 20%. Implemented automated IT operations monitoring using Python and scikit-learn.

projects.name: Gravitational Wave Detection
projects.description: Applied CNN/LSTM architectures to classify Gravitational Wave signals at IUCAA's LIGO Project, achieving improved detection accuracy in noisy datasets. Leveraged PyCBC & Q-transform techniques for time series generation and noise augmentation.
